plead verb
(STATE)
C2 [ I, L only + adj, T ]
  law
  specialized to make a statement of what you believe to be true, especially in support of something or someone or when someone has been accused in a law court: The defendant pleaded not guilty/innocent to robbery with violence. They paid a high-powered attorney to plead their case (= argue for them in court). The judge ruled her unfit to plead (= to answer a legal charge) on the grounds of insanity.
More examplesFewer examplesShe pleaded her innocence, but no one believed her.The accused pleaded not guilty on grounds of diminished responsibility.He did not have to pay his speeding fine because he pleaded diplomatic immunity.The judge won't look favourably on her if she pleads not guilty.You stand accused of murder, how do you plead?
